channel.title: 1 Corinthians on Christian Internet Resources
channel.description: Recent content in 1 Corinthians on Christian Internet Resources

item.title: 1 Corinthians 1
item.description:
1 Corinthians Chapter 1

1Paul, called (to be an) apostle of-Christ Jesus by (the) will of-God, and Sosthenes our brother, 2to-the church of-[the] God [the] being in Corinth, to-the sanctified ones-ones in Christ Jesus, called (to be) saints with all the-ones calling-on the name of-the Lord of-us Jesus Christ in every place, theirs and ours. 3Grace to-you and peace from God (the) Father of-us and (the) Lord Jesus Christ.

4I-thank the God of-me always about you for the grace of-[the] God [the] having-been-given to-you in Christ Jesus, 5because in everything you-were-made rich in him, in all word and all knowledge, 6even-as the testimony of-[the] Christ was-confirmed in you, 7so-that you tend┘not└to-be-lacking in any gracious-gift, expectantly-awaiting the revelation of-the Lord of-us Jesus Christ, 8who also will-continue-to-confirm you to (the) end blameless in the day of-the Lord of-us Jesus Christ. 9[The] God (is) faithful through whom you-were-called into (the) fellowship of-the Son of-him Jesus Christ the Lord of-us.

item.title: 1 Corinthians 2
item.description:
1 Corinthians Chapter 2

1And-I, having-come to you, brothers, I-did┘not└come according-to superiority of-word or wisdom, proclaiming to-you the mystery of-[the] God. 2For I-did┘not└determine to-know anything among you except2 Jesus Christ and this-one crucified. 3And-I in weakness and in fear and in much trembling was with you, 4and the word of-me and the proclamation of-me (were) not in persuasive words, but in demonstration of-spirit and power, 5in-order-that the faith of-you might┘not└be in (the) wisdom of-men, but in (the) power of-God.

item.title: 1 Corinthians 3
item.description:
1 Corinthians Chapter 3

1And-I, brothers, was┘not└able to-speak to-you as spiritual but as physical, as infants in Christ. 2I-gave┘you milk└to-drink, not solid-food. For you-are still physical, for where jealousy and strife (are) among you, are not you fleshly and walk according-to man? 4For when anybody (of you) says, “I am of-Paul,” and another (says), “I (am) of-Apollos,” are-you not men? 5What then is Apollos? And what is Paul? Ministers by whom you-came-to-believe, and to-each as the Lord gave. 6I-planted, Apollos watered, but God made-(it)-grow. 7So neither is the-one planting anything, nor the-one watering, but God the-One making-(it)-grow. 8Now the-one planting and the-one watering are one, but each will-receive [the] his-own pay according-to [the] his-own work. 9For we-are fellow-workers of-God; you are God’s field, God’s building.

item.title: 1 Corinthians 4
item.description:
1 Corinthians Chapter 4

1In-this-way let┘(a) man└consider us: as ministers of-Christ and stewards of-(the)-mysteries of-God. 2Here beyond-that it-is-required in [the] stewards that (a) person be-found reliable. 3But to-me it-is (a) very-small-thing that I-should-be-examined by you or by (a) human court; indeed I-do┘not-even└judge myself. I-am-aware-of┘nothing└against myself, but I-do┘not└stand-justified by this; but the-One examining me is (the) Lord. 5So-that do┘not└judge anything ahead-of time until the Lord comes, who also will-bring-to-light hidden-things of-[the] darkness and will-disclose the plans of-the hearts, and then [the] praise will-be to-each from [the] God.

item.title: 1 Corinthians 5
item.description:
1 Corinthians Chapter 5

1Sexual-immorality is┘actually└reported among you, and such immorality that (is) not -even among the Gentiles, that somebody would-be-living-with (the) wife of-the/his father. 2And are you proud and not mourning instead in-order-that the-one having-done this [the] deed should-be-removed from (the) midst of-you? 3For I, being-absent with-the body but present in-the spirit, have┘already└judged, as-if being-present, the-one having-committed this thus. 4In the name of-the Lord [of-us]ms Jesus, you having-been-assembled and [the] my spirit with the power of-the Lord of-us Jesus, 5deliver such-(a person) to-[the] Satan for (the) destruction of-the flesh, in-order-that the spirit may-be-saved in the day of-the Lord. 6The pride of-you (is) not good. Do-you┘not└know that (a) little yeast leavens the whole lump? 7Clean-out the old yeast in-order-0that you-may-be (a) new lump, even-as you-are unleavened, for also Christ the Passover of-us was sacrificed. 8So let-us celebrate-the-festival, not with old yeast nor with yeast of-evil and wickedness, but with unleavened (bread) of-sincerity and truth.

item.title: 1 Corinthians 6
item.description:
1 Corinthians Chapter 6

1Does┘anybody of-you having (a) matter against the other└dare to-go-to-law before the unrighteous and not before the saints? 2Or do-you┘not└know that the saints will-judge the world? And if the world is-judged by you, are-you unable (to be judges) of-(the)-least (matters)? 3Do-you┘not└know that we-will-judge angels, much-less matters-of-everyday-life? 4So if you-have matters-of-this life, do-you-appoint these (as judges) the-ones to (your shame: 5I-speak to-you to (your) humiliation: (is it) so (that) there-is nobody among you wise, who will be-able to-decide in-the-midst2 of the brother of-him? 6But brother goes-to court with brother and this before unbelievers? 7Already [then]ms it-is (a) defect to-you actually that you-have lawsuits with each-other. On-account-of what rather not be wronged? 8But you wrong and defraud, and this brothers. 9Or do-you┘not└know that unjust-ones will┘not└inherit (the) kingdom of-God? do┘not└deceive-yourselves. Neither immoral-people nor idolaters nor adulterers nor effeminate nor homosexuals 10not thieves nor covetous-people, not drunkards, not revilers, not swindlers will-inherit (the) kingdom of-God. 11And some-of you-were these, but you-were-made-righteous in the name of-the Lord Jesus Christ and in the Spirit of-the God of-us.

item.title: 1 Corinthians 7
item.description:
1 Corinthians Chapter 7

1Now about what-things you-wrote. (It is) good for (a) man not to-touch (a) woman. 2But on-account-of [the] sexual-immorality, each man should-have [the] his-own wife, and each woman should-have [the] her-own husband. 3The husband needs-to-give to-the wife the/her due; and likewise also the wife (needs-to-give) to-the husband the/his due. 4The wife does┘not└have-authority-over [the] her body, but the husband (does). And likewise the husband also does┘not└have-authority-over [the] his body, but the wife (does). 5Do┘not└deprive one-another, except2 for (a) time by agreement in-order-that youpl-may-devote-yourselves to-[the] prayer and be together3 again, in-order-that [the] Satan may┘not└tempt youpl on-account-of the self-control of-you. 6But I-say this according-to concession, not according-to commandment. 7But I-want all men to-be also as myself, but each has his-own gracious-gift from God, the–one thus, on-the-one-hand, and the-other thus, on-the-other-hand.

item.title: 1 Corinthians 8
item.description:
1 Corinthians Chapter 8

1Now about [the]-things offered to idols. We┘all└have knowledge. [The] knowledge puffs up; [the] love builds up. 2If anybody thinks (himself) to-know something, he-did┘not-yet└come-to-know as it-is-necessary to-know. 3And if anybody loves [the] God, this-one has-been-known by him. 4About [the] eating things-offered-to-idols. We know (there is) no idol in (the) world and that nobody (is) God but2 one. 5For even if there-are so-called gods either in heaven or on earth, as there-are many gods and many lords, 6 [but] for-us (there is) one God the Father, from whom (are) [the] all-things and we (exist) for him, and one Lord Jesus Christ through whom (are) [the] all-things and we (exist) through him.

item.title: 1 Corinthians 9
item.description:
1 Corinthians Chapter 9

1Am-I not free? Am-I not (an) apostle? Have-I┘not└seen Jesus the Lord of-us? Are you not the work of-me in (the) Lord? 2If I-am not (an) apostle to-others, [but] I-am to-you. For you are the seal of-the apostleship of-me in (the) Lord. 3[The] my defense to-the-ones sitting-in-judgment-on me is this. 4I-do┘not not┘┘└have (a) right to-eat and drink, do-I? 5I-do┘not not┘┘└have (a) right to-lead-around (a) sister as-(a)-wife, └└ do-I, like the also other apostles and the brothers of—the Lord and Cephas? 6Or do┘I only and Barnabas not└have (a) right not to-work? 7Who at-any-time serves-as-(a)-soldier at┘his-own└expense? Who plants (a) vineyard and does┘not└eat the fruit of-it? Or who shepherds sheep and does┘not└eat [of] the milk of-the flock? 8I-am┘not┘┘└speaking according-to man, └└am-I, or does┘the Law not also└say these-things? 9For in [the] Law of-Moses it-has-been-written, “You-shall┘not└muzzle (an) ox while-threshing.” It-is┘not┘┘└(a) concern to-[the] God of-[the] oxen, └└is-it? 10Or does-he-speak altogether on-account-of us? For on-account-of us he-wrote that the-one plowing ought to-plow in hope and the-one threshing (ought) to-thresh in hop of-[the]-sharing. 11If we sowed to-you [the] spiritual-things, (it is a) great-thing if we harvest [the] physical-things of-you? 12If others are-sharers-of the right from-you, not more we? But we-did┘not└use this [the] right. But we-put-up with all-things in-order-that we-might┘not└give any hindrance to-the gospel of-[the] Christ. 13Do-you┘not└know that the-ones performing the sacred (services) [the]ms eat of-the temple; the-ones waiting-on the altar have-(a)-share-with the altar? 14Thus also the Lord gave-directions to-the-ones proclaiming the gospel to-live from the gospel. 15But I have┘not└used any of-these. And I-did┘not└write these-things in-order-that it-may-be thus in my (case). For to-die (would be) good to-me rather than anybody should empty the boast of-me. 16For if I-preach-the-gospel, (a) boast is not to-me; for necessity lies-on me—for woe is to-me if I-do┘not└preach-the-gospel. 17For if I-do this willingly, I-have┘(a) stewardship└entrusted (to me). 18What then is the reward of-me? That preaching-the-gospel I-present the gospel without-charge to the not making-full-use-of the right of-me in the gospel.

item.title: 1 Corinthians 10
item.description:
1 Corinthians Chapter 10

1I-do┘not└want you to-be-unaware, brothers, that the fathers of-us were all under the cloud and passed–through the sea, 2and all were-baptized to [the] Moses in the cloud and in the sea, 3and all ate the same spiritual food, 4and all drank the same spiritual drink; for they drank from (a) spiritual rock following (them), and the rock was [the] Messiah. 5But not with [the] most of-them was┘[the] God└pleased, for they-were-struck-down in the wilderness. 6But these-things became examples for-us unto our [the] not being coveters of-evil-things even-as they-also coved (them). 7Nor be idolaters even-as some of-them, as it-has-been-written, “The people sat-down to-eat and to-drink, and got-up to-play/carouse.”

item.title: 1 Corinthians 12
item.description:
1 Corinthians Chapter 12

1Now concerning [the] spiritual gifts, brothers, I-do┘not└want you to-be-unaware. 2You-know that when you-were Gentiles, you-were led-astray to [the] dumb [the] idols. 3Wherefore I-make-known to-you that nobody speaking by (the) Spirit of-God, says, “Jesus (is) accursed”; and nobody is-able to-say, “Jesus (is) Lord,” except2 by the Holy Spirit.

4Love (is) longsuffering: love is kind; is┘not└jealous, [the] [love]ms is┘not└conceited, is┘not└arrogant, 5does┘not└behave-improperly, does┘not└seek the-things of-itself, is┘not└easily-upset, does┘not└keep-track of-[the] evil, 6does┘not└rejoice in [the] injustice, but rejoices in the truth; 7puts-up-with all things, believes all-things, hopes all-things, endures all-things. 8[The] love never falls. But if (there are) prophecies, they-will-be-put-away; if (there are) languages, they-will-stop; if (there is) knowledge, it-will-pass-away. 9For we-know in part and we prophesy in part. 10But when the perfect comes, the in-part will-pass-away. 11When I-was (a) child, I-used-to-speak like (a) child, think like (a) child, reason like (a) child. When I-became (a) man, I-put-away the-things of-the/a child. 12For now we-see by (a) mirror in (an) obscure-image, but then I-will-know even-as also I-was-known 13But now remains faith, hope, love, these [the] three-things; but [the] love (is the) greatest of-these.

item.title: 1 Corinthians 14
item.description:
1 Corinthians Chapter 14

1Pursue [the] love, and earnestly-desire [the] spiritual (gifts), but specifically in-order-that you-may-be-prophesying. 2Ffor the-one speaking in (a) language is┘not└speaking to-men but to-God, because nobody is-understanding; but by-(the)-Spirit he-speaks mysteries. 3But the-one prophesying speaks to-men edification and exhortation and consolation. 4The-one speaking in-(a)-language builds┘himself└up, but the-one prophesying builds┘(the) church└up. 5Now I-am-willing for you all to-speak in-languages, but specifically in-order-that you-may-be-prophesying. And the-one prophesying (is) greater than the-one speaking in-languages unless3 he-translates in-order-that the church may-receive edification.

item.title: 1 Corinthians 15
item.description:
1 Corinthians Chapter 15

1Now I-make-known to-you, brothers, the gospel that I-preached to-you, that you also received, and in which you┘also└stand, 2and by which you-are-being-saved if you-hold-on-firmly to which word I-preached to-you—unless2 you-believed in vain. 3For I-delivered to-you among first-things, what also I-received, that Christ died for the sins of-us according-to the scriptures, 4and that he-was-buried and that he-has-been-raised on-the third [the] day according-to the scriptures, 5and that he-appeared to-Cephas, then to-the twelve, 6and that he-appeared to-over five-hundred brothers at-the-same-time, of whom the more remain till now, but some fell-asleep. 7Then he-appeared to-James, then to-all the apostles. 8And last of-all he-appeared also-to-me, as-it-were, to-one born-at-and-unusual-time-of-year. 9For I am the least of-the apostles, who am not worthy to-be-called (an) apostle, because I-persecuted the church of-[the] God. 10But by-(the)-grace of-God I-am what I-am, and the grace of-him [the] to me was not in vain, but I-labored more than they all, but not I, but the grace of-[the] God [the] with me. 11So whether I or those, thus we-preach and thus you-believed.

item.title: 1 Corinthians 16
item.description:
1 Corinthians Chapter 16

1Now about the collection [the] for the saints. Even-as I-directed the churches of-[the] Galatia, so you-do also. 2Every first (day) of-(the)-week, let┘each of-you└lay by him storing-up whatever2 things-go-well, in-order-that when I-come, collections will┘not└take place. 3And when I-arrive, whomever2 you approve—I-will-sent these through letters to-carry the gift of-you to Jerusalem. 4And if it-is fitting for-[the] me-also to-go, they-will-go with me.

5Now I-will-come to you when I-pass-through Macedonia, for I-do-pass-through Macedonia. 6And perhaps I-will-stay with you or even winter (with you), in-order-that you-may-send┘me└forward whenever2 I-come. 7For I-do┘not└want to-see you now in passing, for I-hope to-remain with you for (a) certain time, if the Lord allows. 8But I-will-stay in Ephesus until [the] Pentecost. 9For (a) door opened to-me, wide and effective, and (there are) many opponents.
